Title: Sadako Japanese Restaurant
Address: 1321 S University Ave, Ann Arbor, MI 48104
Description: Sushi, sashimi, rolls & bento box lunch specials served in a bustling space with a relaxed vibe.

parking: Somewhat difficult to find a space

summary.snippet: "Good prices, large servings, friendly staff, great variety, warm environment!"
"Good food, service, price, and a great location in Ann Arbor."
"Tuna for the spicy rolls had a bad fish smell and was not edible."

most_relevant.description: Sadako is an absolute gem! The sushi was not only delicious but also prepared beautifully. The service was top-notch—quick yet not rushed. Our waiter was incredibly attentive, recommending some outstanding dishes and engaging in pleasant conversations. The restaurant's cleanliness and tasteful decor added to the fantastic experience. I give it a solid 10/10 recommendation and can't wait to visit again!

This is my first time here, and I'm really satisfied. The best time to go is during lunch, when they have more affordable bento boxes starting at $13 (11:30 am - 2 pm).

I ordered the beef teriyaki, which surprisingly came with tempura and sushi as well. We also got miso soup and salad. What a healthy life!

YES, YES AND YES!! Keep it simple, this place is clean, good prices and awesome customer service! I’ve been here numerous times and they DONT MISS with their sushi! Stop in, get yourself a roll or two and you’ll know what I’m talking bout!

To be fair, my experiences with sushi are mostly from East Asia and the West Coast in the States.
At least for sushi, this is not the right place. The portion of the rice for nigiri shouldn't be large like theirs. Also, the rice was too sticky. It ruined the texture in my mouth. Then, I recognized the raw fish part wasn't really fresh. The worst part was their roll.. When I had the first bite, I immediately noticed that the fish in the roll was worse than those on the nigiri. I smelled something wasn't right, and I checked the texture and the color of the salmon, and it seemed fermented more than it was supposed to. Maybe they expected the spicy sauce might hide the bad salmon. But, as I am a sensitive person, I figured that I could never finish the plate and didn't even try to go further.
They might do better with their warm dishes. But, I don't think it's a place for sushi or roll.

This is my number one sushi place in Ann Arbor. In 2014-2018 when I lived in Ann Arbor/Ypsi, I’d find every excuse to come here! I believe it’s family owned and local to Ann Arbor. The sushi rolls are reasonably priced and always fresh tasting. I can’t not emphasize how much I love the spicy mayo and always get it on the side.

Sushi rolls left to right (3rd pic): spicy tuna, fried Philly roll, sadako crunch roll (the best roll)

Probably one of the most chill and relaxed Sushi spots I've come across, it had the magic of making me go back in time to my travels in Japan.

I had the spicy tuna roll and the flavors, freshness and taste were phenomenal. I would recommend getting one of the large dinner bento if your really hungry or else just go for one of the simple rolls, as the quantities here are massive.

The customer service was exceptional as the staff were helpful in getting me to decide what exactly to get. The inside decor is simple and traditional and the sushi chefs at the back really look like they are pro at what they do.

I do recommend coming here in the near future and do look forward to coming here!
So much too choose between being a college town. But Oh wow did we make a great choice. The food is fresh the owner (?) is friendly and helpful.

Terrible quality and customer service. I got a bamboo roll that came with no spicy mayo inside as advertised and the tuna was old and mealy. I called to ask to get a salmon roll instead and the manager I spoke with was very rude. She said I just looked at the tuna and it’s perfectly fine, why are you saying that, and also insisted they had put spicy mayo inside it. I literally unrolled and dissected one of the pieces to make sure it wasn’t there and it definitely wasn’t. I ate two pieces and was worried the tuna would make me sick so I threw out the rest, but unfortunately she refused to give me a different roll so I went hungry for lunch.

Her attitude was genuinely shocking, a salmon roll costs like $8 so it’s not like i was asking for something crazy. Stay far, far away from this place.
